This is due to the fact that humans by nature stay emotionally healthy through socializing, but due to the importance of modern technology to maintain a financially satisfying standard of life they gradually themselves. As time passes by each of these individuals gets stuck in a vicious circle of loneliness that eventually leads to suicidal attempts especially among youngsters.In conclusion, similarly to every other invention computers have their benefits and drawbacks, I personally think it all depends upon how we use the given tools . Moderation is the key here to keep the balance and allow us to live in harmony.
',

prompt:
Prompt:
In many countries children are engaged in some kind of paid work. Some people regard this as completely wrong, while others consider it to be a valuable work experience, which is important for learning and taking responsibility. What is your opinion on this?

Essay: 
In the Third World, children are usually sent to factories for laborious work. Many people believe that it is merely exploitation, while others think it is a good opportunity for them to life experience. In any case, children have their right to live and study in peaceful conditions. Therefore, using them as workforce is considered an unacceptable action.First of all, children are not workers. They have just learned about the vast world and do not have any experience or concept of working. Since these innocent children are naive and , they can be easily cheated and exploited. There are many examples of this in poor nations. Because using children is cheap and to control, many enterprises hire them and don\x80\x99t pay them much. Although the government in these countries has tried its best, this kind of taking advantage of children cannot be eliminated.Moreover, children do not need such thing as \x80\x98valuable work experience\x80\x99 that is supposedly \x80\x98important for learning and taking responsibility\x80\x99. The brief responsibility of children is learning. They are not old enough to understand what working experiences are. Nevertheless, they can help parents do chores or housework. This will be a much better way for them to become more responsible for . In addition, childhood is one of the most remarkable memories and must not be taken away by forcing them to work.In conclusion, since all children are the great concern of parent and society, they should be allowed to enjoy life and rather than to work. Hence, one must ponder what view is actually appropriate for the sake of the children.
',
chosen:
'evalutation': 'Revised Essay:

In many countries, children are often involved in paid work, particularly in Third World nations. Some individuals argue that this is an act of exploitation, while others believe it offers valuable work experience and teaches responsibility. In my opinion, I consider child labor to be completely wrong as it infringes upon their rights to live and study in peaceful conditions.

Firstly, it is important to acknowledge that children are not equipped to be workers. They are still in the process of discovering the world and lack any experience or understanding of work. Due to their innocence and vulnerability, they are easily taken advantage of and exploited. This is particularly evident in impoverished nations, where children are hired by enterprises for cheap labor and are not adequately compensated. Despite efforts made by the government to address this issue, child exploitation continues to persist.

Moreover, children do not require the so-called "valuable work experience" that is supposedly essential for learning and taking responsibility. Their primary responsibility lies in learning and education. They are not mature enough to comprehend the significance of work experience. However, they can contribute to their families by assisting with chores or household tasks. This would be a more suitable way for them to develop a sense of responsibility. Additionally, childhood is a precious phase of life that should not be stripped away by forcing children to work.

In conclusion, since the well-being of children is a significant concern for parents and society, they should be given the opportunity to enjoy their lives rather than being compelled to work. It is crucial to reflect upon what is truly appropriate for the sake of the children.'}]

prompt:
Prompt:
Should wealthy nations be required to share their wealth with poorer nations by providing them with things such as food and education? Or is this the responsibility of the governments of poorer nations to look after their citizens?

Essay: 
I think that wealthy nations should be required to share their wealth with poorer nations. at providing such things as food and education because of the three following reasons.Firstly, citizens of both wealthy nations and poorer nations are human beings. Therefore, we can not look at, hear of, or talk about people who lack food, education, without compassion and sympathy. Sharing wealth with poorer nations is not only a good deed but is also a .Secondly, many nations in Africa and Asia are poor. Famine, diseases, crime and illiteracy are killing the citizens of these countries. , many nations in Europe and America are rich. If there are no actions taken, this inequality will increase dramatically. Poor countries will become poorer while rich countries will become richer. As a result, the poorest countries will become slaves of the richest countries. So, sharing wealth is useful way to prevent people from that bad future.Thirdly, although sharing wealth with poorer nations is very necessarythis help should only stop at providing such things as food, medicine and education. Or else, poor nations may become dependent on the aid. They may lose enthusiasm to build their countries by themselves. Moreover, rich nations can take advantage of sharing wealth to interfere with the governance of poor nations\x80\x99. This can\x80\x99t be considered a humane action and should be prevented.In my opinion, sharing wealth with poorer nations has both a bad side and a good side. What we have to do is its bad side and its good side.
',
chosen:
'evalutation': "Revised Essay: 
In today's globalized world, the issue of whether wealthy nations should be obligated to share their wealth with poorer nations is a highly debated topic. While some argue that it is the responsibility of the governments of poorer nations to look after their citizens, I firmly believe that affluent nations should be required to provide aid in the form of food and education. This essay will outline three reasons why wealthy nations should share their wealth with poorer nations, considering the humanitarian aspect, the potential consequences of inequality, and the need for limited aid.

Firstly, it is our moral duty as human beings to show compassion and empathy towards those who are less fortunate. Regardless of nationality or socioeconomic status, every individual deserves access to basic necessities such as food and education. By providing aid to poorer nations, wealthy countries can fulfill their obligations as members of the global community and contribute to the well-being of humanity as a whole.

Secondly, the wide disparity in wealth between developed and developing nations poses a significant threat to global stability. Neglecting the needs of poorer nations can lead to a perpetual cycle of poverty, which may result in social unrest, political instability, and increased migration. By sharing their wealth, affluent nations can help alleviate these issues and promote a more equitable distribution of resources. This not only benefits the poorer nations but also ensures a more stable and secure world for everyone.

However, it is important to recognize that aid should have limitations. Providing support in the form of food, medicine, and education is essential, but it should be done in a way that encourages self-sufficiency and sustainable development. Excessive reliance on external assistance can hinder the growth and progress of poorer nations, as it may discourage them from taking responsibility for their own development. Furthermore, wealthy nations must ensure that their aid does not come with any ulterior motives or attempts to influence the governance of the recipient countries.

In conclusion, wealthy nations have a responsibility to share their wealth with poorer nations for several reasons. By doing so, they can fulfill their moral obligations, address global inequality, and promote stability. However, it is crucial to strike a balance between providing aid and empowering poorer nations to take charge of their own development. With careful consideration and strategic implementation, sharing wealth can have a positive and transformative impact on the world."}]

prompt:

The past twenty years have seen a dramatic change the number of students who go abroad . In this essay, I will explore the advantages and disadvantages of this trend.On the one hand, both students and their country can benefit from this trend. First, students can choose more suitable methods for themselves because there are more options. The and teaching methods are quite different . According to foreign experts, Secondly, people can improve their foreign language, they can contact with when they are in a foreign country, and they quickly master the foreign language. Thirdly, it helps to promote the mutual understanding between their mother land and their destination countries. These students exchange information with the locals. Students can get better understanding of the countries. People in their home country will get more vivid information about other countries . Similarly, the locals also can get more clear recognition about other countries.On the other hand, there are disadvantages too. Firstly, it costs people a lot of money to begin college in foreign countries. Many families have to take out all their savings to support their children abroad. Secondly, some students cannot stand the big difference the new environment, they quit their study and come back home.To conclude, given the fact that in foreign countries helps students with their studies and promotes the mutual understanding countries, even if there are some drawbacks, I think the benefits outweigh the problems.
',

chosen:
'evalutation': 'Re-evaluated Essay (Band 6.0):

The essay demonstrates some understanding of the prompt and attempts to present both sides of the argument. However, there are several areas that need improvement in order to meet the band 6.0 criteria for IELTS writing.

1. Task Achievement:
The essay partially addresses the prompt by discussing the importance of both rest and mental development during leisure time. However, the argument lacks coherence and clarity, making it difficult to follow. The essay would benefit from a clear introduction that presents the two viewpoints and a conclusion that summarizes the main points.

2. Coherence and Cohesion:

Example of improvement: "In conclusion, while it is important to give one's mind a rest during leisure time, it is equally crucial to engage in activities that stimulate mental development. Ultimately, individuals should choose activities that align with their personal preferences and goals, whether it be reading a book or participating in physical exercise. By striking a balance between rest and mental engagement, individuals can optimize their leisure time and enhance their overall well-being."

3. Lexical Resource:
The essay demonstrates a limited range of vocabulary and often relies on repetitive phrases. There is also a lack of precise and specific language, which hinders the clarity of the argument. The use of colloquial language and contractions should be avoided in formal writing.

Example of improvement: "Some individuals may opt for relaxation activities such as watching movies, reading, or receiving a massage to unwind from their demanding professions. For instance, doctors, teachers, and builders, who engage in physically and mentally strenuous work, may feel the need to rejuvenate their bodies and minds after a long day. 4. Grammatical Range and Accuracy:
The essay contains numerous grammatical errors, such as subject-verb agreement issues, incorrect word order, and missing articles. These errors affect the clarity and accuracy of the argument. The essay would benefit from careful proofreading and editing to correct these errors.

Example of improvement: "On the other hand, some people choose to be active during their leisure time because they lead sedentary lives during their work hours. For example, individuals who spend the entire day sitting may experience backaches and overall fatigue. Engaging in activities like going to the gym or swimming can help alleviate these physical discomforts and improve their overall health."

prompt:

Essay: 
The modern medicine is very important for living a long life. It on new technology. . Also modern medicine is human body. . Therefore I agree that the modern medicine to live longer.First of all, the modern medicine can prevent incurable diseases. Doctors can find some diseases very early. Then doctors can give suitable medicines to patients. New modern doctors . Also intelligent people in the world live a long life modern medicine. That is very important in the human society because their creative things are coming with them and they can help others for a longer time when they are living ., old population is increasing in the country. It is country\x80\x99s economy and third world countries. But old people are very important in human society because their experience definitely helps to . \x80\x98Experience is better than qualifications\x80\x99 However, old people are living a long life; it is helping others to live a long life because we can get advice from them and they are covering our culture and society.Moreover, modern medicine is being addictive for some people, so that they cannot live without medicine. They should take medicine all their lives. Also modern medicine is very expensive. Therefore most of poor countries modern medicine and it has taken a commercial shape, also it is depending on money. In the modern medicine human kindness. People who have money can take modern medicine. But indigenous medicine has well human friendly shape. It does not depend on money.To summarize; in my personal view, modern medicine is helping to live a long life . Modern technologies are being supported to find diseases very early. So doctors can take immediately. Therefore, hesitate to agree with the above mentioned statement.Your essay has several confusing sentences, where your meaning is unclear.You mix advantages and disadvantages of the modern medicine in one paragraph when you should divide them \x80\x93 have advantages in one paragraph and disadvantages in another.If you agree with the statement, you should have 2 paragraphs supporting your opinion and one supporting the opposite opinion, in your essay it is 2 against and 1 for.
',
chosen:
'evalutation': 'Re-evaluated Essay:

Modern medicine plays a significant role in prolonging one's lifespan. It is supported by new technology and advancements. Additionally, modern medicine contributes to the overall well-being of the human body. Therefore, I agree that modern medicine helps individuals live longer lives.

Firstly, modern medicine can effectively prevent incurable diseases. Doctors have the ability to detect diseases at an early stage, enabling them to provide suitable medicines to patients. With the aid of modern technology, doctors are able to diagnose illnesses accurately and prescribe appropriate treatments. Consequently, many intelligent individuals in the world are able to lead longer lives due to the advancements in modern medicine. This is crucial for society, as these individuals continue to make valuable contributions and assist others for an extended period.

Furthermore, the increasing elderly population in many countries is beneficial for the economy and the development of third-world nations. The experience and wisdom of older individuals greatly contribute to society. As the saying goes, "Experience is better than qualifications." When elderly individuals live longer lives, they are able to provide valuable advice and insights to younger generations, thereby preserving and enriching our culture and society.

On the other hand, modern medicine can become addictive for some individuals, leading them to rely on medication for the rest of their lives. Additionally, modern medicine can be costly, making it inaccessible for people in poor countries. The commercialization of modern medicine has made it dependent on financial resources, hindering its availability to those in need. In contrast, indigenous medicine often maintains a more human-friendly approach, as it is not solely dependent on money.

In conclusion, modern medicine undeniably contributes to the longevity of human life. The assistance of modern technologies facilitates the early detection of diseases and prompt treatment. While there are certain disadvantages, such as addiction and high costs, the benefits of modern medicine outweigh these drawbacks. Therefore, I strongly agree with the statement that modern medicine helps individuals live longer lives.

Re-evaluation of the Essay based on IELTS Writing Criteria:

1. Task Response: The essay addresses the prompt by expressing agreement that modern medicine helps individuals live longer lives. The writer provides supporting arguments and examples to support their viewpoint. However, the essay lacks a clear structure and could have presented a stronger counter-argument.

2. Coherence and Cohesion: The essay demonstrates weak coherence and cohesion. The ideas are not clearly organized, with paragraphs mixing advantages and disadvantages instead of separating them. The essay would benefit from a clearer structure with distinct paragraphs for each supporting point.

3. Lexical Resource: The essay shows a limited range of vocabulary, with some inaccuracies and unclear phrasing. Additionally, there are instances of repetition and awkward sentence structures. Expanding the vocabulary and using more precise language would enhance the essay.

4. Grammar: The essay contains numerous grammatical errors, including subject-verb agreement, sentence fragments, and incorrect word usage. Careful proofreading and editing would significantly improve the grammar and overall clarity of the essay.

Overall, this re-evaluated essay would receive a band score of 4.0. It demonstrates an understanding of the prompt and presents arguments, but inconsistent organization, limited vocabulary, and frequent grammar errors prevent it from achieving a higher score.'}]

prompt:

The advantages of the spread of English as a global language will continue to outweigh its disadvantages. To what extent do you agree or disagree?

Essay: 
There is no doubt that these days more people is learning and talking by English language. The question is, is this viral of English has a negative view or not? In this essay I will discuss and draw my personal conclusion.
In terms of advantages there is many. Firstly, this spread of English language wil make the communication easier more than before . In other words, travelling to a new country that you are not speak there language is not a big problem these days because most of people are speaking English or at least know the main essential questions and there answers .To illustrate, If you are travelling to Italy you don't have to learn Italian language your English will be enough. Secondly, some languages are hard to learn like Chinese and Turkish, so using the English as a united language is much easier than using other language.
Moreover the massive spread to English may had some disadvantages the main given reason I support this claim is that the consist of using English language in countries will make some other languages disappear. To illustrate, some countries now are choosing not to speak with their naive language and replace it with English in work and school and all daily conversations. On other hand, some countries like Turkey most of their citizens will ignore you when you don't ask them with Turkish.
In conclusion, although this spread of English may diminish other languages, but still having English language is important. That's why I believe that using English is essential especially if you are working with international companies and collegues.
",

prompt:
Prompt:
Write about the following topic.With the improvements in today\x80\x99s health care, society has to care for more and more elderly people.Do you feel that society will be able to cope with the increase in numbers of elderly people today and how can it be managed?Give reasons for your answer and include any relevant examples from your own knowledge or experience.

Essay: 
In our modern society and the development and improvement of health care sector, the average expected life age has increased comparing to what it was like in the past. This as good as it is, aslo raised the cncern of tkaing care of elderly people. In my opinion, I believe that the ability to deal with this concern depends on two main factors, which are the degree of country developement as well as the society characteristics.
First of all, to be able to take care of elderly people, the relevant orginizations and innstitutions should be in place. However, this condition most of the time cannot be found in under-developed countires. That is because of the lack of funding resources. On the other hand, more developed countries, such as The Netherlands, Norway, and other european countires, are more capable of taking care of elderly. That is because they have the enough resources to fund such non-profitable orginizations.
Nevertheless, other factor that must be taken into account, is the society characteristcs. Here we mean, wheather the society is considered individualist or socialist. In social societies, countries do not need to allocate a lot of resources on elderly care, because this role is already taken by families. Where in individualist societies, most of the times elder people will be living alone. Therefore, when they reach the point where they cannot take care of themselves, they will go to elderly care houses.
To summarize, the ability to taking care of elderly people depends on two main factors, the country developement and the society type. If the country is developed or the society is considered social, taking care of the mental and physical health of elderly people will be eaiser. In contrast, if the country institutions are under-developed or the society is considered individualist, taking care of eldery people will be much harder.
',
chosen:
'evalutation': "Revised Essay:

In our modern society, advancements in healthcare have led to an increase in the average life expectancy compared to the past. This positive development has also raised concerns about how to care for the growing elderly population. In my opinion, the ability to address this concern depends on two main factors: the country's level of development and the characteristics of its society.

Firstly, the presence of relevant organizations and institutions is crucial in providing care for elderly people. However, this condition is often lacking in underdeveloped countries due to a lack of funding resources. On the other hand, more developed countries such as The Netherlands, Norway, and other European countries are better equipped to take care of the elderly because they have sufficient resources to fund non-profit organizations dedicated to this cause.

Moreover, the characteristics of society also play a significant role. Specifically, whether a society is individualistic or socialist impacts its approach to elderly care. In social societies, the responsibility of caring for the elderly is often assumed by families, which reduces the need for extensive resources allocated to elderly care. In contrast, individualistic societies often have a higher number of elderly people living alone. When these individuals reach a point where they can no longer care for themselves, they rely on elderly care centers or nursing homes.

In conclusion, the ability to provide adequate care for elderly people depends on two key factors: the level of development in a country and the societal values it holds. Developed countries or societies with a more collective approach to caring for the elderly are better equipped to manage the physical and mental health needs of this population. Conversely, underdeveloped countries or individualistic societies face greater challenges in providing care for the elderly. Overall, the ability to cope with the increasing number of elderly people depends on the specific context in which they are situated. 

Re-evaluation according to IELTS Writing criteria:

1. Task Achievement:
The essay addresses the prompt and discusses the ability of society to cope with the increasing number of elderly people. The writer provides reasons and examples to support their points. However, the discussion could be more comprehensive, and some points could be further developed.

2. Coherence and Cohesion:
The essay has a clear structure with an introduction, body paragraphs, and a conclusion. The writer uses transition words to connect ideas and paragraphs. However, there are some errors in sentence structure and word choice that affect coherence.

3. Lexical Resource:
The writer demonstrates a reasonable range of vocabulary and uses relevant terminology related to healthcare and society. However, there are errors in spelling and word choice that occasionally impede understanding.

4. Grammatical Range and Accuracy:
There are errors in grammar, including subject-verb agreement, verb tense consistency, and sentence structure. These errors sometimes make the meaning unclear or cause confusion.

Overall, the revised essay demonstrates an understanding of the topic and provides relevant arguments and examples. However, there are notable errors in coherence, grammar, and vocabulary that affect the clarity and accuracy of the essay. Based on these criteria, the essay would likely receive a band score of 5.0 or 5.5 rather than 6.0."}]

1. Task achievement: The essay partially addresses the prompt by discussing the ability of society to cope with the increase in elderly population. However, the essay could have provided more specific examples and suggestions on how to manage this increase.

Based on these criteria, I would suggest a band score of 4 for this essay. To improve the score, the writer should focus on improving coherence and cohesion, using appropriate vocabulary and grammar, and providing more specific examples and suggestions.

prompt:
Prompt:
Write about the following topic.Some people think that we should divide students based on their academic ability, while others think we should educate all students together. Discuss both views and give your opinion.Give reasons for your answer and include any relevant examples from your own knowledge or experience.

Essay: 
Nowadays, a topic often discussed is the education and its relation with the difference in people's ability and possibilities. According to some, it should be better to separate students based on their academic skills, while others believe that a valid education can be transmitted without discriminating people based on their ability.
People that support the separation of students believe that an omogeneous group can learn better and faster. Indeed, if someone has less skills compared to the others component of the group, teachers have two possibilities. First, to lower the level of the lessons in order to allow a catch up. Second, leave behind the student wiht low ability. Both solutions are not optimals. Thus, if we put together students with similar capabilities, we can make the process of learing more efficent for both groups.
The other vision is to educate students all together. By doing so, you can encourage low skills students to engage theirselves to catch up with the most brilliant one. Moreover, if you split the group, students with less capabilities can develop self-estimation problems and so, they will think that they can not be in the "best" group. Another good point for educate all students together is that people with higher ability will help their classmates. However, the level of the class will be probably lower.
To conclude, I think that the best solution depends on the purpose of the educator and on the age of students. Indeed, it is very differet the education of children or teenagers. For example, if you want to create the future class of engineers, you should divide students based on their academic ability. But if you want to educate people as humankind you should not divide the class.
',

I believe students should be divided according to their academic ability this is because specific students require different amounts of support according to their abilities.
Students that are divided based upon their academic ability are more likely to learn specific parts of their subjects. This will help students not only to learn more but also help them gain more confidence so that they can believe in themselves and so that they are more likely to understand the information required by their subject as they are recieving extra help.
However if students are divided according to their academic ability they are more likely to feel bored as they may not have their peers to interact with and there's also a high chance that the students may feel isolated as they believe they feel like they do not have the knowledge requirements for their subjects which can demotivate the students and further leading to poor grades.
If students are educated together they can feel like that their not left out and they can help recieve information from their peers which can help them further understand the subject.
However if the students are educated together there's a high chance that they are more likely to be distracted by their peers and they would be less focused on their subjects which can lead too poor grades. Morever if students are educated together there's also a chance that specific students may not understand what the teacher is teaching or talking about as diffrerent students have different understandings and academic abilities.
Overall I believe students should be divided according to their academic abilities this is because students are more likely to understand the information provided by their teachers as they are provided with additional support and students should be more mature enought to undertsand that if they do not meet specific academic requirements they should not be demotivated, they should understand how to handle the situation and show that they can be courageous enough to do even better as the students are provided with additional support.
",
chosen:
'evalutation': "Revised Essay:

There is an ongoing debate about whether students should be divided based on their academic ability or educated together. While some argue that dividing students can provide tailored support and boost their learning, others believe that educating students together promotes inclusivity and peer learning. In my opinion, students should be divided according to their academic abilities, as this approach allows for targeted support and encourages self-confidence.

Dividing students based on their academic ability can cater to their specific learning needs. For instance, students who require extra support can benefit from smaller class sizes and personalized attention from teachers. This individualized approach not only enhances their understanding of the subjects but also boosts their confidence. By receiving additional help, these students are more likely to believe in their own capabilities and grasp the information required by their subjects.

However, there are drawbacks to segregating students based on their academic ability. One major concern is that it can lead to feelings of boredom and isolation among the less academically advanced students. They may miss out on the opportunity to interact with their peers, which is essential for social development. Additionally, being placed in a lower academic track can demotivate students and result in poor grades. It is important to strike a balance between division based on ability and maintaining a sense of belonging and inclusivity.

On the other hand, educating students together can foster a sense of belonging and encourage peer learning. Collaborating with classmates can help students gain different perspectives and deepen their understanding of the subject matter. By learning from their peers, students can develop important social and communication skills, which are highly beneficial in the real world.

However, there are challenges associated with educating students together. The presence of distractions from peers can hinder students' focus and overall academic performance. Furthermore, without tailored support, students with different academic abilities may struggle to keep up with the pace of the class. This can lead to gaps in their understanding and hinder their overall learning progress.

In conclusion, while there are valid arguments for both dividing students based on their academic ability and educating them together, I believe that division according to ability is more beneficial. It allows for targeted support and enhances students' self-confidence. However, it is crucial to ensure that students in different tracks still have opportunities for social interaction and support. Ultimately, students should be mature enough to handle their academic placement and strive to excel with the additional help provided."}]

prompt:
Prompt:
Write about the following topic.The issue of gay marriage remains controversial. Some people think that this trend has adverse effects on the society while others believe that it is seen as a natural trend and right for people to choose this type of marriage. Should gay marriage be legal?Give reasons for your answer and include any relevant examples from your own knowledge or experience.

Essay: 
The topic of gay marriage merely failed to be discussed. However, when it comes to whether gay marriage should be allowed legally, individuals hold divergent views. As far as I am concerned, the government should treat gay marriage as a legal thing.
Undoubtedly, gay marriage can be beneficial. First of all, it is able to shrink the disparity between the affluent and the impoverished. For instance, some countries which allow gay marriage legally have become well-known tourism sites now by attracting foreign gays to come. Thus, their tourism industry can be thrived and the moribund local economy can be turned into the resurgent one, which may help to avoid turning the gap into gulf. Additionally, allowing gay marriage to be legal is also able to undermine the crime rate. On condition that some gays cannot enjoy the right of marriage, they may feel underrated, underprivileged and underappreciated, which may give them the predisposition to revenge the society to express their resentment and dissatisfaction. What is more, the government is able to diminish cultural conflict through making gay marriage a law. Provided that some individuals get little acquainted with gay culture, they may deem it as aggressive. However, by admitting it as a low, we can minimize such vulnerability and promote the mutual understanding of divergent cultures.
On the other hand, treating gay marriage legally also has various disadvantages. Firstly, it may undermine family rapport for the reason that some family members may not willing to accept gay marriage, which may cause the increasingly indifferent among family members and finally lead to family skirmish and splintering. In addition, some young individuals are possible to make mistakes at an early age if the government makes gay marriage law. It is widely acknowledged that some young people are not mature enough to choose the right partner. Provided that they get married at an early age, they may suffer irreversible loss.
To sum up, although there are some disadvantages to let gay marriage be legal, the benefits of it are multifaceted. Considering the development of the economy and culture, I agree with allowing gay marriage to be a legal option.
',
chosen:
'evalutation': 'Revised Essay:

The topic of gay marriage is a highly debated issue. People have different opinions on whether gay marriage should be legally allowed. In my opinion, the government should recognize gay marriage as a legal institution.

Gay marriage can have several benefits. Firstly, it can help reduce the gap between the rich and the poor. For example, countries that have legalized gay marriage have seen an increase in tourism from foreign gay couples. This boosts the local economy and helps bridge the economic divide. Furthermore, legalizing gay marriage can also help reduce crime rates. When some individuals are denied the right to marry, they may feel marginalized and resentful towards society. This can lead to acts of revenge or dissatisfaction. By granting them the right to marry, the government can promote inclusivity and reduce potential conflicts.

However, legalizing gay marriage also has its drawbacks. It can negatively impact family relationships, as some family members may not accept gay marriage. This can lead to strained and fractured family dynamics. Additionally, young individuals may make hasty decisions if gay marriage becomes legal. It is widely acknowledged that young people may not have the maturity to choose the right partner at an early age. This could result in irreversible consequences.

In conclusion, while there are disadvantages to legalizing gay marriage, the benefits outweigh the drawbacks. Considering the positive effects on the economy and culture, I support the legalization of gay marriage.'}]

prompt:
Prompt:
Write about the following topic.In some parts of the world people try to find out one's own family history. Why do people do this? Do you think it is a positive or negative?Give reasons for your answer and include any relevant examples from your own knowledge or experience.

Essay: 
In some countries it is a common practice for people to track down their bloodline's history. People give different motivations as to why they do it. I suppport this activity for reasons I will further explain in this essay.
To begin with, some people want to get information about their family's history just of pure interest. It can be a great hobby for someone to invest their time and enegry into. It will help one destress and have some fun, while also enrichening his area of knowledege. In addition to having something entertaining do to in their free time, one will learn a lot about what his family has been thorugh long before he was born. This is really important because without our anscestors we would not have been born or in other words - without the past there would be no future. If one respects his family and himself enough, he should learn about who they were and where they came from.
Furthermore, learning about one's family history can be very benefitial in finding your talents. For instance, if someone finds out that in the family there once was someone who was great footballer, then this is something one should try out. Geneticaly, some people are born with specific talents, predisposing them to pursuit a ceratin career path. Being aware of your family's past can be a great hint towards your strenghts and weaknesses.
In conclusion, finding out your family's history is not only a fun hobby that you can do in your spare time, it can also assist you in finding your talents in life without having to always try out new activities.
",

prompt:
Prompt:
Write about the following topic.There are several factors that motivate people to stay in the workforce, and money is the most important reason/factor. To what extent do you agree or disagree?Give reasons for your answer and include any relevant examples from your own knowledge or experience.

Essay: 
With the development of society, it goes without saying that more people come to prior their carrier to their own private life. Some people say that this is due to money, however, I strongly oppose that money has the hugest impact on this choice in modern society. I feel this way for 2 reasons, which I will explore in the following essay.
To begin with, working is considered one of the crucial factors to fulfill people's life. Specifically, most people would be satisfied when they are helpful to others through their work. Besides, these experiences would easily contribute them to further hard work. Above all, human beings originally like being appreciated by someone. To be more specific, I like my job because I can feel self-confident through my work. It is manifest that money is not only the vital motivation for working in this regard.
Some augments can be made that social status gained through the success of their business must be crucial enough to direct people to work. The main reason for this is that experiences of success would bring excitement and happiness to them. They also could feel superior to others. Close examination would reveal that people with high social status could have tons of options compared with common people. That is to say, it is completely evident that higher social status can become an important factor as money.
Having considered all the augments above, I would conclude that only money has the most influence on motivation for business. There must be other vital factors present such as social statius and rewarding/
",
chosen:
'evalutation': "Revised Essay:

In today's society, many individuals prioritize their careers over their personal lives. While some argue that money is the primary motivator for staying in the workforce, I strongly disagree. In my opinion, there are other significant factors that influence this decision. This essay will explore two reasons to support my stance.

Firstly, work plays a crucial role in fulfilling people's lives. Many individuals derive satisfaction from being able to help others through their work. These experiences often serve as motivation for individuals to work harder and strive for success. Moreover, humans have an innate desire to be appreciated by others. Personally, I derive a sense of self-confidence from my job. This clearly indicates that money is not the sole driving force behind work motivation.

Additionally, the social status attained through professional success can be a compelling factor in motivating individuals to stay in the workforce. Achieving success brings a sense of excitement and happiness, making individuals feel superior to others. Furthermore, individuals with high social status have access to a wide range of opportunities that may not be available to the general public. Therefore, it is evident that social status can be just as influential as money in motivating individuals to remain in the workforce.

Taking all these factors into consideration, it can be concluded that money is not the sole determinant of work motivation. Other significant factors, such as social status and personal fulfillment, also play a crucial role. Therefore, it is incorrect to claim that money is the most important factor in motivating individuals to stay in the workforce."}]

prompt:
Prompt:
Write about the following topic.Some people feel that manufacturers and supermarkets have the responsibility to reduce the amount of packaging of goods. Others argue that customers should avoid buying goods with a lot of packaging. Discuss both views and give your opinion.Give reasons for your answer and include any relevant examples from your own knowledge or experience.

Essay: 
The public is rarely found agreeing on one opinion. One might take a simpe problem such as manufacturers responsible for excessive packaging, or customers should avoid buying such goods as example. Let me tackle this problem in brief.
Manufacturers and supermarkets may be noticed selling their goods excessivly packaged, and that may dissatisfy a portion of their customers. Those customers believe that such sellers should reduce such packaging. Looking into it, it sounds that sellers would also be responsible if their goods where damaged, which would lead to a decrease in income. It also does cost a little more to wrap goods securely to avoid damage, so while that may be a little inconvenient for manufacturers, it is necessary to avoid serious losses later on.
Customers have full right to avoid excessivly packaged goods, if it so contrasts their taste. They may feel it is tiresome to unwrap, or hard to get rid of all the mess it creates afterwords. They would think that is a manufacturer's task to unwrap the goods once they are available at the market, or even once the arrive at their houses if it is an online service. It would logically seem much convenient to them to have instant access to their product instead of all the unpackaging that preceeds the unboxing purchased goods.
Personally, I believe a little unwrapping isn't so invonvenient, and it doesn't have to fall on a manufacturer to unwrap his goods before selling. A little unpackaging might even be thrilling sometimes, to build up excitement before unboxing your awaited product. I'd add, with little offense meant, that people are getting a little lazy to do a simple task as unpackaging.
",

prompt:
Prompt:
Write about the following topic.Some people believe that one of the best ways to solve environmental problem is to increase the cost of fuel for cars and other vehicles. To what extent do you agree or disagree?Give reasons for your answer and include any relevant examples from your own knowledge or experience.

Essay: 
Most vehicles release a toxic amount of fumes into the atmosphere. This, in turn, has grown into an environmental issue of global concern that governments across the world believe can be mitigated by adding on to the price of fuels. I chiefly disagree with the effectiveness of this method as next to nothing had been altered since the policy enforcement due to convenience issues.
The number of cars utilizing fuel has not dwindled. Even though many alternatives had been suggested, there was no mass production of transportation units for the use of average salary workers. The middle crust of society does not possess sufficient income to shift to environmentally friendly solutions for the fear of maintenance hardships. For instance, an electrical car would necessitate a spacious charging spot in front of a garage that not many possess. As a consequence, the more convenient and trustworthy solution to buy fuel is resorted to.
The population of the world as a whole does not stay in one place. As more and more people are born, there is a growing need for transport to be manufactured in a short span of time. Although a part of the population may be able to abandon their cars in exchange for bikes or buses, a significant portion of the growing society still opts for refueling cars in gas stations to get to places faster.
In conclusion, while the idea of the price policy introduction bore few fruits, they had not been enough to make a contribution to solving the carbon footprint. Ironically, people would rather overspend for their comfort than think about nature.
',

These errors include incorrect verb forms, missing articles, and inconsistent verb tense usage. There are also instances of inappropriate word order and sentence fragments. Overall, the essay demonstrates a limited grammatical range and accuracy.

Based on these evaluations, the suggested band score for this essay would be around 5.0 to 5.5. The essay partially achieves the task and demonstrates partial coherence and cohesion. The lexical resource is somewhat limited and there are several grammatical errors.

prompt:
Prompt:
Write about the following topic.The most important function of music is that it helps people reduce stress. To what extent do you agree or disagree?Give reasons for your answer and include any relevant examples from your own knowledge or experience.

Essay: 
Many today have come to the conclusion that the most significant effect on people of music is to relieve stress. While I agree that music also has more important positive functions other than reducing stress.
On the one hand, I have to admit that music is a good way to reduce stress and it do plays an important role in our daily life. A good example of this can be seen in Shanghai, where has a large number of single karaoke rooms in the office buildings. As we all know, compared to the others cities in China, the people living in Shanghai face more stress, like the surprisingly high price of house and the fierce competition of work. Those public karaoke rooms, which were provided by the government for the public, become a good place for people to enjoy the music and have fun.
On the other hand, for many people, music is an ideal career to persue in their life, like the job as an accountant, which can bring them with incomes and improve their living standard. For example, the TV programs related to music attract more and more people to participate in, like The Voice. Most of the participants wish to show their excellent peformance in music through these stages with the purpose of having access to more business opportunities and making more money at the same time. It is undeniable that the following income would be exponential increased than before if they succeed finally.
In conclusion, it is not doubt that music is very essential for us, not only for its spiritual meanings, but also for its more important role in our society which could allow the person to relise their dream while creating more economical benefits.
',
chosen:
'evalutation': 'Re-evaluated Essay:

Many people today believe that the main function of music is to help individuals reduce stress. While I agree that music can indeed have a soothing effect, I believe that it serves other important purposes as well.

On one hand, I acknowledge that music is an effective tool for stress reduction and plays a significant role in our daily lives. For instance, in cities like Shanghai where residents face immense pressure due to high housing costs and intense work competition, there are numerous public karaoke rooms in office buildings. These facilities, provided by the government, serve as an excellent outlet for people to enjoy music and have fun, thereby alleviating their stress levels.

On the other hand, for many individuals, pursuing a career in music is a dream come true. Similar to professions such as accounting, music can provide individuals with a stable income and improve their living standards. The growing popularity of music-related TV shows like "The Voice" has attracted an increasing number of participants who aim to showcase their exceptional talent and seize business opportunities. If successful, these participants can significantly increase their income and find more financial success than before.

In conclusion, while music does indeed have a positive impact on reducing stress, it also serves other significant functions. It not only carries spiritual meaning but also offers individuals the chance to pursue their dreams and create economic benefits. Therefore, it is evident that music plays a vital role in our society.'}]

Based on these criteria, I would suggest a band score of 6.5. The essay shows some strengths in addressing the topic and providing relevant examples, but there are areas that could be further developed and improved to achieve a higher band score.

prompt:
Prompt:
Some people think history has nothing or little to tell us, but others think that studying the past history can help us better understand the present. Discuss both views and give your opinion.

Essay: 
There are two possible ways to interprete the significance of history experience for our everyday life.
The first point is to ignore the history experience. The main reason is based on the opinion that history never repeats. All historical persons that lived at the elder times never made their decisions in the conditions those surround us. The world has changed significantly. Technology, information, transport, medicine, human rights - all these important parts of our life has changed since the elder times. So, we can not directly copy the decisions of different problems of the elder times to our present life.
The second point is to use the history experience in our present life. This opinion is based on observed samples of very similar intervals of history. At different time periods in different countries there were some events or historical processes being very similar. There are a lot of examples illustrating this thought. All countries of Medieval Europe and Asia past through the feodalism period. Then leaders of that counties decided that the feodalism is not the most effective way to control the country and annuled it. Nowadays we know that experience and, I believe, there will be no attempts to buld the feodalism again. The second example is the practice of conquestions. There were a lot of great conquerrors in the world's history: Alexander Macedonian, Caesar, Chinggis-khan, Napoleon, Gitler. All the listed persons conquerred big territories, their armies were very strong. But some time past and their empires were broken. Sometimes their enemies united against the conquerrors, sometimes they just died and their successors could not save the empires. But always the empires died. Nowadays we have no any signs of old borders of that empires. Actually all state borders are based on nations' borders, not on the old conquestions.
I think the second opinion is better. The reason is following. There are a lot of institutions in our life that we like. For example, human rights, property rights, education, medicine. All these institutions appeared as a result of historical experince. If our predecessors ignored that experience, we would never live in the modern society. In that case we would have no modern medicine and education, also we would live in the society with slaver. So, I think that we should thoroughly study the historical experience and use its conclusions in our present life.
",

prompt:
Prompt:
In many countries people increasingly talk about money (how much they earn or how much they pay for things in their daily conversations). Why? Is this a positive or negative development?

Essay: 
This essay will talk about the general increase in talking about money.
I will expose why I believe this is a negative development.
In worldwilde terms there has been a general society empoverishment.
In general terms, inflation has beaten the entire world very hard due to the fluctuations in energy prices, furthermore the war between Russia and Ucrania has worsen even more this fluctuation as Russia has almost stopped suppling Gas to Europe. On the other hand Ucrania was the biggest Europes seed warehouse and our economy at the food industry has also been affected by huge price increase.
However salaries have not been rised up enough to reach inflation rate which directly has driven society to a loss of value. This fact induces us to speak more often and more in detail about prices, about our salaries or about our home rentals. Population wonders how come our governments are not settling different actions to repair this huge loss which is causing biggest wealth inequality rates, dividing even more the society between wealthy and poors and sending a lot of population to thicken "the under the poverty line" population .
Newspapers and communication agencies daily inform about war status, but lately they are forgoting to insist on the economy crash we are suffering. Only in France there have been important strikes to report their disomfort with the enlargement of the retirement age as well as the general price increase.
To summarise, the economical situation worldwide is wobbling, and the least we can do is talking about it.
',
chosen:
'evalutation': 'Re-evaluated essay:

This essay discusses the increasing trend of discussing money in daily conversations and argues that this is a negative development. In recent years, there has been a global impoverishment due to factors such as inflation and geopolitical conflicts. Fluctuations in energy prices and the war between Russia and Ukraine have exacerbated inflation, leading to a rise in prices for basic commodities. However, salaries have not kept pace with inflation, leading to a loss of value for society. This has prompted people to discuss prices, salaries, and housing rentals more frequently and in greater detail.

The lack of government actions to address this issue has further exacerbated wealth inequality and deepened the divide between the rich and the poor. Many people have been pushed below the poverty line, and this situation is not given enough attention by the media. While newspapers and communication agencies provide regular updates on war-related matters, they often neglect to highlight the economic crisis that is affecting people's lives. The example of strikes in France against the increase in retirement age and rising prices demonstrates the discontent among the population.

In conclusion, the global economic situation is unstable, and it is only natural for people to talk about it. However, the lack of effective measures to address this crisis and the widening wealth inequality make this trend of discussing money a negative development.

Re-evaluation:

Criterion 1: Task Achievement

The essay addresses the prompt by discussing the increasing trend of talking about money and providing reasons why this is a negative development. The writer effectively presents the idea that the global economic situation is unstable and highlights the impact on society. However, the essay could have provided more specific examples and evidence to support the arguments. Therefore, the essay demonstrates an adequate level of task achievement.

Criterion 2: Coherence and Cohesion

The essay displays some coherence and cohesion, but there are several issues that hinder the flow of ideas. The essay lacks clear paragraph structure, making it difficult for the reader to follow the writer's train of thought. Moreover, the use of sentence fragments and run-on sentences further disrupts the coherence. Additionally, the essay could have benefited from the use of linking words and phrases to connect ideas more effectively. Overall, the essay exhibits some coherence and cohesion but would benefit from improvements in organization and sentence structure.

Criterion 3: Lexical Resource

The essay displays a range of vocabulary, with some attempts at using less common words and phrases. However, there are instances of inappropriate word choices and errors in word form. For example, "empoverishment" should be "impoverishment," and "disomfort" should be "discomfort." Additionally, there are instances of awkward phrasing and grammatical errors that affect the clarity of the writing. Therefore, the essay demonstrates a limited level of lexical resource.

Criterion 4: Grammatical Range and Accuracy

The essay shows an attempt at using a variety of sentence structures, including complex sentences. However, there are numerous grammatical errors throughout the essay, including incorrect verb tenses, subject-verb agreement issues, and errors in preposition usage. These errors hinder the clarity and accuracy of the writing. Therefore, the essay demonstrates a limited level of grammatical range and accuracy.

Overall, based on the re-evaluation of the essay against the four criteria of IELTS writing, this essay would still be awarded a band 5.5. The essay demonstrates an adequate level of task achievement but falls short in coherence and cohesion, lexical resource, and grammatical range and accuracy.'}]
rejected:
'Criterion 1: Task Achievement
The essay partially addresses the prompt by discussing the increase in talking about money and presenting an opinion on whether it is a positive or negative development. However, the essay lacks a clear structure and coherent arguments to support the opinion. It also does not provide a balanced view by considering both the positive and negative aspects of talking about money. Therefore, the essay does not fully achieve the task.

Criterion 2: Coherence and Cohesion
The essay lacks proper organization and coherence. The ideas are presented in a disjointed manner, making it difficult for the reader to follow the arguments. There are also instances of irrelevant information, such as the details about the war between Russia and Ukraine, which is not directly related to the topic. Additionally, there are errors in sentence structure and grammar, further hindering the overall clarity and cohesion of the essay.

Criterion 3: Lexical Resource

The repetition of certain words and phrases, such as "general" and "huge," also hinders the lexical variety. Furthermore, there are instances of word omission and misspelling, as seen in "Ucrania" instead of "Ukraine." 

Criterion 4: Grammatical Range and Accuracy

Overall, based on the four criteria of IELTS writing, this essay would likely receive a band score of 4. The essay partially addresses the task and lacks coherence and cohesion. The lexical resource is limited, and there are numerous grammatical errors throughout the essay.

prompt:
Prompt:
In many countries people increasingly talk about money (how much they earn or how much they pay for things in their daily conversations). Why? Is this a positive or negative development?

Essay: 
Material achievement has been discussed at a high frequency in some countries; people widely involve this topic in every aspect of their lives. This essay will give two possible reasons for this phenomenon and explain the negative impacts on society.
Two major causes keep people lingering on this topic. Firstly, the difficulties in earning a living in some countries have significantly drawn people's focus on finance. For instance, more job opportunities are needed for job seekers in countries with low productivity. Besides that, in many low-income countries, people have to endure low pay; in some extreme cases, their earnings can not cover their spending. Therefore, tremendous anxiety cause people from these countries constantly talk about their financial situations.
On the other side, flaunting is becoming the mainstream mindset in some countries. Commonly, in some countries that just escaped poverty, the increasing spared money makes showing off possible. People in these countries display their wealth by owning luxurious items, such as branded bags or jewelry. Therefore, money naturally becomes essential in their conversations.
Although the reasons for money focusing vary, it might develop into risky societal factors. If the frequent discussion of finance is due to insufficient employment or inadequate wages, it is an alarm to the governments to carry on measures of boosting industries' development. Otherwise, riots might be expected and harm social safety. Furthermore, this widespread discussion highly leads to material comparison, which harms morality and even allows crimes to occur. When individuals obsess with showing off, they feel the shame of disposing of the downsides. To maintain a perfect image- especially a wealthy appearance, some people even turn to crime, such as stealing or robbery.
To conclude, folks popularly discuss money for various reasons, such as the demands of work or psychological factors. However, the phenomenon is not a positive sign to society and most likely indicates the upcoming crisis.
",
chosen:

Task Achievement: The essay effectively addresses the prompt by discussing why people in many countries increasingly talk about money and evaluating whether this is a positive or negative development. 2. Coherence and Cohesion: The essay is well-structured with a clear introduction, body paragraphs, and conclusion. Each paragraph focuses on a specific point and is logically connected to the overall argument. Transition words and phrases are used effectively to maintain coherence and cohesion. Ideas are developed and supported with relevant examples and explanations, making it easy for the reader to follow the writer's line of thought. 

3. Lexical Resource: The writer demonstrates a wide range of vocabulary and uses it accurately to express ideas. There is evidence of less common and idiomatic vocabulary, such as "lingering on this topic," "spared money," and "disposing of the downsides." The writer also uses collocations effectively, such as "drawn people's focus," "boosting industries' development," and "harm social safety." Overall, the essay shows a strong command of vocabulary and effectively communicates the intended meaning. 

4. Grammar Range and Accuracy: The essay demonstrates a high level of grammatical accuracy and complexity. In conclusion, this essay effectively addresses the prompt, maintains coherence and cohesion, demonstrates a wide range of vocabulary, and showcases a high level of grammatical accuracy. Therefore, it deserves a band score of 8.5 in terms of IELTS writing criteria.'}]

prompt:
Prompt:
Some people believe that governments should pay full course fees for students who want to study in universities. Do you agree or disagree with this statement?

Essay: 
In recent years, in some countries, including Japan, some people believe that governments should cover all tuition fees for students who are willing to study at university. Although the total cost will be massive and the governments need to increase the tax on citizens, I strongly agree with this opinion.
To begin with, it is absolutely unfair for students who need to give up going to university because of a lack of money. In Japan, they need to terminate to pursue their study at university, there are many students who study diligently though. If the government supported them financially, those who terminated their study could have continued studying and had the great job opportunities they hoped for.
In addition, some developed countries have been suffering from depopulation so there are some industries, such as IT, and Civil engineering that chronically have a problem with how to improve the shortage of employees. If governments encourage students to study these industries at university for free, the companies will be not only helpful to increase the number of employees, and also effective for students to obtain some qualifications in advance in university. This
means that the companies do not necessarily spare longer training time than usual for new employees.
Furthermore, economic growth is linked inextricably with education. If all students could have a variety of courses at university for free charge, they will be able to obtain skillful techniques and plenty of knowledge to pursue their career opportunities regardless of age. In addition, they will be able to study with working at the same time with light-hearted such as nighttime courses, and weekend courses. If they could work and study flexibly, they will obtain more creative ideas to improve their work. If they are required to pay more tax due to the education fee by governments, they are more than happy to pay the tax for themselves and other ambitious students.
In conclusion, the free education system in universities must be advantageous to improve their countries' economic growth in the long term.
",
chosen:
'evalutation': 'Overall, this essay addresses the prompt and provides reasons to support the idea that governments should pay full course fees for students studying in universities. However, there are areas where the essay could be improved to achieve a higher band score. 

1. Task Achievement: The essay adequately addresses the prompt and presents a clear position on the topic. The writer agrees with the statement that governments should cover all tuition fees for university students. However, there could be a stronger introduction that clearly states the writer's position.

2. Coherence and Cohesion: The essay has a logical structure with clear paragraphs and topic sentences. However, there is room for improvement in terms of linking words and phrases. The essay lacks cohesive devices to connect ideas within and between paragraphs. Including words like "Furthermore" and "In addition" would enhance the cohesion of the essay.

3. Lexical Resource: The essay demonstrates a good range of vocabulary, with words such as "depopulation," "chronically," and "skillful techniques." However, there are instances of repetition and the use of generic phrases such as "the companies" and "the governments." The writer could further improve their lexical resource by using more specific and varied vocabulary.

4. Grammatical Range and Accuracy: The essay shows a reasonable control of grammar with mostly accurate sentence structures. However, there are some errors in verb tenses and subject-verb agreement. For example, "If the government supported them financially, those who terminated their study could have continued studying and had the great job opportunities they hoped for" should be "If the government supported them financially, those who terminated their study could have continued studying and have the great job opportunities they hope for." Paying attention to these errors would improve the grammatical range and accuracy of the essay.

In conclusion, while this essay adequately addresses the prompt and presents reasons to support the idea of government-funded university education, there are areas for improvement in terms of task achievement, coherence and cohesion, lexical resource, and grammatical range and accuracy. With some revisions and improvements, this essay has the potential to achieve a higher band score.'}]

prompt:
Prompt:
Some people believe that governments should pay full course fees for students who want to study in universities. Do you agree or disagree with this statement?

Essay: 
This essay agrees on the need of that governments should pay full course fees for students who want to study in universities, but always under one premise: those students should have demonstrated their capability to comply with university studies successfully.
There are countries, for example Scandinavian countries, where their government helps students by giving them specific students' loans. These loans have special characteristics such as long loan terms and low interest rates. It is not for free, but at least a higher number of students can have access to upgrade their studies.
And in many other European countries university fees are not large, so most of the students can access to bachelor studies. What it's not easy is having the needed qualification you need to access to the specific university study you want.
If we talk in worlwide terms, university studies are limited to wealthy people.
In fact I read only a couple of weeks ago that only a 17% of worlds' population have university studies. There is a contradiction between developped and non developped countries. As an example, in most countries in Europe we have too many university students. Actually they cannot find a job easily at their own country and sometimes they emigrate to another country in Europe or outside Europe. Furthermore vocational workers such as plumbers, waiters or receptionists can't be found, there no unemployment in vocational work!.
The opposite happens in non developped countries. As university studies have large fees, almost nobody can access to them, and vocational workers suffer unemployment, so they need to emigrate to other countries to find jobs.
To summarize, I believe fees should not be an obstacle to study in a university. The obstable should be your previous califications.
Education and Health, as much as a country can hold them, should be available for all population, poor and wealthy, with non differentiation.
",
chosen:
'evalutation': "Revised Essay:

This essay agrees with the idea that governments should pay full course fees for students who want to study in universities, but it emphasizes that students should demonstrate their capability to excel in university studies. For instance, in Scandinavian countries, the government provides specific student loans with long loan terms and low interest rates, enabling a larger number of students to pursue higher education. Although these loans are not free, they still offer increased accessibility to university studies.

Moreover, in many European countries, university fees are relatively affordable, allowing most students to enroll in bachelor's programs. However, the main challenge lies in meeting the qualifications required for admission into the desired university program. Therefore, while fees may not be a major obstacle, students must possess the necessary qualifications to access their preferred fields of study.

Globally, university studies are predominantly pursued by the wealthy population. Shockingly, recent statistics revealed that only 17% of the world's population holds a university degree. This disparity is particularly noticeable between developed and undeveloped countries. Developed nations, such as those in Europe, witness an excessive number of university students. Regrettably, these graduates often struggle to find suitable employment within their home countries, leading many to immigrate to other European nations or even countries outside Europe. Conversely, in underdeveloped countries, the high cost of university fees renders higher education inaccessible to the majority, resulting in a surplus of unemployed vocational workers who are compelled to seek employment abroad.

In conclusion, educational fees should not impede individuals from pursuing university studies. Instead, the primary obstacle should be the fulfillment of necessary qualifications. Education, along with healthcare, should be available to all citizens, irrespective of their socioeconomic backgrounds. By removing financial barriers, governments can ensure equal opportunities for all individuals to access higher education."}]
rejected:
'Criteria 1: Task Achievement
The essay addresses the prompt and provides a clear position on the issue. The writer agrees that governments should pay full course fees for students who want to study in universities, but only if the students have demonstrated their capability to succeed in university studies. The essay also considers the situation in different countries and provides examples to support the argument. Overall, the essay achieves the task of discussing the topic and expressing a clear opinion.

Criteria 2: Coherence and Cohesion
The essay is relatively well-organized and coherent. It begins with an introduction that states the writer's position and introduces the main argument. Each paragraph focuses on a specific point and provides relevant examples or arguments to support it. However, there are some instances where the ideas could be better connected, and the essay lacks transitions between paragraphs. With some improvements in the organization and the use of cohesive devices, the essay could achieve a higher score in this criterion.

Criteria 3: Lexical Resource
The essay demonstrates a good range of vocabulary, with appropriate use of academic and formal language. The writer uses specific terms such as "university studies," "vocational workers," and "qualification" to discuss the topic accurately. However, there are a few instances of repetitive language and some minor errors in word choice. A wider variety of vocabulary and better word choice could enhance the essay's score in this criterion.

Criteria 4: Grammatical Range and Accuracy
The essay generally uses a variety of sentence structures and demonstrates a good level of grammatical control. There are some minor errors in subject-verb agreement and word order, but they do not significantly hinder understanding. With more consistent and accurate use of grammar, the essay could achieve a higher score in this criterion.

Overall, based on the above evaluation, I would suggest a band score of 6.5 for this essay. With some improvements in coherence, vocabulary, and grammar, the score could potentially increase to 7.

prompt:
Prompt:
Some people believe that governments should pay full course fees for students who want to study in universities. Do you agree or disagree with this statement?

Essay: 
Nowadays many people argue that univerties graduation should be sponsouring by governments institution in other to provide this level of education for each one who desires it. I disagree with this argument as, in my opinion, isn't a governments role provide a higher education for the whole society.
First of all, the most important government task is guarantee a better level of basic education. So having great public schools to fundamental level, enable all students to been accept or get the approval for any univerties and even to requires a schoolarship, when it is necessary. Governments shouldn't spend public money in graduation or higher level education, in order to keep all efforts on be the number one in fundamental education.
Another public politic which may shows a good results is provide a specials credit lines for students who haven't enouth money to pay full tuition fees. These type of credit might create a sense of responsability and encourage students to loooking for a good job as soon as they've concluded the course. This kind of financial should consider that payment only starts after the end of their course.
In conclusion, I would argue that having the government paying the fees for university studies isn't looks to be a good solution to guarantee an university access for whole population. States should keep investing and execute their role to persue the best fundamental public education and might enable their students to get into any university. If those student haven't enouth money or condition to pay all fees, states only need to provide a special credits to them.
",
